title: Breaking: Aston Martin name new team principal in reshuffle - Racingnews365.com
summary:
Aston Martin Appoints Andy Cowell as New F1 Team Principal

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Aston Martin has announced the appointment of Andy Cowell as the new Formula 1 team principal, succeeding Mike Krack, who has been reassigned to chief trackside officer.

  • Andy Cowell, previously CEO and head of Mercedes High Performance Powertrains, will combine the roles of CEO and team principal.
  • Mike Krack, appointed in 2022, transitions to chief trackside officer.
  • The team's structure includes dedicated trackside and factory-based teams reporting to Cowell.
  • Enrico Cardile has been named chief technical officer, overseeing the development of new race cars.
“I have spent the last three months understanding and assessing our performance, and I've been incredibly impressed by the dedication, commitment and hard work of this team,” explained Cowell.
“With the completion of the AMR Technology Campus and our transition in 2026 to a full works team... we are on a journey to becoming a Championship-winning team.”

The leadership changes are part of Aston Martin's multi-year strategy to enhance their F1 team's competitiveness.
newTitle: Aston Martin Appoints Andy Cowell as New F1 Team Principal

title: Varun Aaron announces retirement from representative cricket - Cricbuzz
summary:
Varun Aaron Announces Retirement from Representative Cricket

Published on: Fri, Jan 10, 2025, 10:01 AM
Source: Cricbuzz

Fast bowler Varun Aaron has retired from all representative cricket following Jharkhand's exit from the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. After giving up red-ball cricket, he now relinquishes white-ball formats as well.

  • Varun Aaron, 35, has announced his retirement after a career spanning over two decades.
  • He took three wickets at an average of 53.33 in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Aaron mentioned his gratitude and love for fast bowling in his retirement announcement on Instagram.
  • He made his debut in ODI and Test cricket after a remarkable performance in the 2010-11 Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Aaron played 18 international matches, taking 29 wickets for India.
  • In first-class cricket, he took 173 wickets and appeared in nine IPL seasons, winning a title in 2022.
“Fast bowling has been my first love, and though I step off the field, it will always be a part of who I am.” - Varun Aaron

Aaron's departure marks the end of a significant chapter in his cricketing journey, but he looks forward to enjoying life beyond the field.
newTitle: Varun Aaron Announces Retirement from Representative Cricket

title: 'Ready to host': PCB dismisses stadium-delay reports ahead of Champions Trophy - The Times of India
summary:
'Ready to host': PCB dismisses stadium-delay reports ahead of Champions Trophy

Date: [Insert publication date here] Source: Times of India

The Pakistan Cricket Board has assured that it is prepared to host the ICC Champions Trophy from February 19 to March 9, dismissing concerns over stadium readiness that circulated on social media.

  • The ICC Champions Trophy will take place across three cities: Lahore, Karachi, and Rawalpindi, along with some matches in Dubai.
  • Recent reports suggested delays due to incomplete stadium construction, which the PCB has labeled as rumors.
  • Pearations include nearly PKR 12 billion spent on upgrading stadiums to meet international standards.
  • The PCB is closely monitoring the construction work to ensure timely completion.
“We gave the statement because our media also started flashing such speculative news without checking the facts.”

Overall, the PCB seeks to confirm that they will be ready to host the Champions Trophy on schedule, addressing fears of relocation due to delays.
newTitle: 'Ready to host': PCB dismisses stadium-delay reports ahead of Champions Trophy

Champions Trophy: Will Rohit Sharma have a shot at redemption? - The Times of India
summary:
Champions Trophy: Will Rohit Sharma have a shot at redemption?

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma, the Indian cricket captain, faced a tumultuous year from a T20 World Cup victory to criticism of his performance. As the ICC Champions Trophy approaches, he seeks redemption in his game and leadership.

  • Rohit Sharma is regarded as a leading player in one-day cricket, with significant achievements, including three double hundreds and 10,000 ODI runs.
  • India's upcoming ODI series against England will serve as preparation for the Champions Trophy.
  • Rohit finished as the second-highest run scorer in the 2023 ODI World Cup.
  • His previous Champions Trophy performances include 10 matches, 481 runs, with a top score of 123 not out against Bangladesh in 2017.
  • Maintaining a positive mindset and focusing on consistent performance will be vital for his success in the tournament.
“Rohit's experience has taught him to treat both success and failure equally and he understands that some failures won't define his career.”

With the potential for Rohit to reclaim his top form and lead his team to victory, the Champions Trophy represents a critical opportunity for redemption.
newTitle: Champions Trophy: Will Rohit Sharma have a shot at redemption?

title: "He’s got one of the best defences": Ashwin hails Indian player despite his ordinary performances in five-Test series against Australia - Crictoday
"He’s got one of the best defences": Ashwin hails Indian player despite his ordinary performances in five-Test series against Australia - Crictoday
Gautam Gambhir will not be able to 'drop Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli': Manoj Tiwary - Hindustan Times
summary:
Manoj Tiwary on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Importance in Indian Cricket

Publication Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent interview, former Indian cricketer Manoj Tiwary expressed his views on the leadership decisions surrounding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, emphasizing their irreplaceable roles in the team.

  • Tiwary believes Rohit Sharma's decision to skip the Sydney Test was his own, despite questions about his leadership.
  • He stated that Gautam Gambhir, the head coach, would not drop Rohit or Kohli due to their talent and past performances.
  • Concerns were raised about the performance of both Rohit and Kohli during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which India lost 1-3 to Australia.
  • Tiwary criticized the selection process, suggesting Jalaj Saxena should have been included in the squad in place of Tanush Kotian.
“This should not be done by a captain. I think Rohit Sharma is a tremendous talent. He has proven himself.”

Tiwary calls for a reassessment of the selection criteria to ensure deserving players are acknowledged.
newTitle: Manoj Tiwary on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Importance in Indian Cricket
